thread.section_title: Four Seasons Hotel George V Paris - UPDATED 2017 Reviews & Price Comparison (France) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Stately
thread.title_full: Stately - Review of Four Seasons Hotel George V Paris, Paris, France - TripAdvisor

author: London_Brief
title: Stately
text:
My wife and I stayed at the George V for an early spring weekend, to see the Ic√¥nes de l'art moderne exhibition at the Fondation Louis Vuitton, and Claus Guth's production of Lohengrin at the Opera Bastille, and to spend some time wandering in Paris.
The hotel was everything that we expected. The location, just off the Champs Elysee, was perfect; the flowers and massive silver sculptures in the lobby were entrancing; the room was large, and comfortably furnished (with books to read, if bored); and the cosmopoiltan staff were unobtrusively efficient, welcoming, and happy to converse despite our rather imperfect French. True old-fashioned luxury.
On the other hand, in such a location, you too are part of the perfomance. So, though the experience was undoubtedly a highly enjoyable one, it was not wholly relaxing - and (or course) the cost of it all does not even bear thinking about.
